TopicTitle: Got to watch my first launch early this morning!

Articles.Content:
Got to watch my first launch early this morning! Here is the launch of the SpaceX Falcon 9 at 4:00AM this morning. Announcer on 1 minute delay. Actual sound of the rocket doesn't hit us until the very end of the video. AWESOME!

Click here to watch

Edited August 6, 2014 by Probus

you. are. so. lucky.

So awesome. There's an early morning Delta 2 launch from Vandenburg scheduled for November. I may try to see that one.

you. are. so. lucky.

IKR!! I really want to watch a launch... Unless I go to Kazakhstan all the launch sites are really far...

Probus, after trying it out for 20+ nodes, I have a few thoughts.

1. Mechjeb surface/Orbital info need to be earlier in the tech tree.

2. Definitely rockets first--Firespitter requires a commitment to deal with fussy parts that I don't have, and FAR makes rudimentary craft difficult to fly, especially on a budget.

3. I really miss my AIES parts, and am really looking forward to you adding them.

I will play more tonight and see if I cannot come up with something more intelligent to add.

Are you sure this is the right thread?

Awesome, I remember watching the shuttle go up when I was about 9.

now I have seen 'bout 10 or 12 launches, so it's a bit less awe inspiring.
